txt.en: 'My soldiers are holding the approaches under constant assault, but these Dunlendings barely know how to fight.'
'Are you prepared to return to Echad Dúnann now?'
'Now they have brought siege engines against us, and they are picking us off one by one.'
Instance: The Siege of Barad Morlas
'I need you to kill those siege crews! Now get out there, time is our enemy!'
Defeated a siege-weapon team
An Elven defender has been defeated
Defeated the Dunlending commander

While the Elves are skilled warriors capable of easily fending off the Dunlendings' assaults, the siege-engines in the field have them pinned down and are dwindling their numbers. You must take to the field, find the siege-engines, and defeat their crews, buying respite for the Elven defenders.
An Elven defender has been defeated
With his siege-engines out of commission and his assault faltering, the Dunlending commander is leading a final attack against the bridge. He must be stopped.
You have created an empowered sapphire!
Having defeated the Dunlendings and routed their forces, you may now use the ancient forge to empower your infused sapphire with the blessings of the Elves.
Talk to Perimbant
Speak with Perimbant to return to Echad Dúnann.
Defeat siege-weapon teams ([placeholder]/4)
Defeat the Dunlending commander
Use the ancient anvil
<rgb=#FF0000>Elvish Defenders Slain ([placeholder]/14)</rgb>
Defeat the Dunlending Captain
Use the Ancient Anvil
<rgb=#FF0000>Bonfire Doused ([placeholder]/6)</rgb>

The Elves have launched an attack to retake Barad Morlas from the Dunlendings who have invaded Eregion. While the initial attack was successful, a larger force of Dunlendings fell upon the Elves while they were caring for their wounded. Now trapped among the ruins and pinned under assaults from the Dunlendings' siege-engines, the Elves are in desperate need of aid.
'Well done my friends! If your mission here is complete, I can provide mounts back to Echad Dúnann.'
'Reinforcements? About time! I've wounded here that can't be moved yet.'
'I am sorry that I was unable to assist you during the battle. My thanks to you for saving my kinsmen!'
